parameters.name: PointX
parameters.description: x coordinate in pixels relative to upper-left corner of the screen (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointY
parameters.description: y coordinate in pixels relative to upper-left corner of the screen (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrowPos
parameters.description: Arrow position as defined in swArrowPosition

parameters.name: TitleString
parameters.description: Title of bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: MessageString
parameters.description: Message for bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: TitleBitmapID
parameters.description: ID of the bitmap to display in the bubble ToolTip as defined in swBitMaps (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TitleBitmap
parameters.description: Path and filename of the bitmap to display before TitleString in the bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: UrlLoc
parameters.description: Any valid Windows Internet Explorer file to display in the body of the bubble ToolTip (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: Add-in's application ID specified in ISwAddin::ConnectToSW

parameters.name: LinkStringID
parameters.description: ID of the hyperlink as defined in swLinkString (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LinkString
parameters.description: String to show as the hyperlink in the bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: CallBack
parameters.description: Name of the callback function for the hyperlink

title: ISldWorks.ShowBubbleTooltipAt2
description: Displays a bubble ToolTip at the specified location.
signature:
void ShowBubbleTooltipAt2( 
   System.Int32
PointX
,
   System.Int32
PointY
,
   System.Int32
ArrowPos
,
   System.String
TitleString
,
   System.String
MessageString
,
   System.Int32
TitleBitmapID
,
   System.String
TitleBitmap
,
   System.String
UrlLoc
,
   System.Int32
Cookie
,
   System.Int32
LinkStringID
,
   System.String
LinkString
,
   System.String
CallBack
)

parameters.name: PointX
parameters.description: x coordinate in pixels relative to upper-left corner of the screen (see Remarks )

parameters.name: PointY
parameters.description: y coordinate in pixels relative to upper-left corner of the screen (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrowPos
parameters.description: Arrow position as defined in swArrowPosition

parameters.name: TitleString
parameters.description: Title of bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: MessageString
parameters.description: Message for bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: TitleBitmapID
parameters.description: ID of the bitmap to display in the bubble ToolTip as defined in swBitMaps (see Remarks )

parameters.name: TitleBitmap
parameters.description: Path and filename of the bitmap to display before TitleString in the bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: UrlLoc
parameters.description: Any valid Windows Internet Explorer file to display in the body of the bubble ToolTip (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: Add-in's application ID specified in ISwAddin::ConnectToSW

parameters.name: LinkStringID
parameters.description: ID of the hyperlink as defined in swLinkString (see Remarks )

parameters.name: LinkString
parameters.description: String to show as the hyperlink in the bubble ToolTip

parameters.name: CallBack
parameters.description: Name of the callback function for the hyperlink

remarks:
If PointX and PointY are both set to 0 and TitleBitmapID is swBitMapTreeError and a PropertyManager page is displayed, then the bubble ToolTip will appear in the same location as the SOLIDWORKS Design user-interface Rebuild Errors bubble ToolTip. You must specify both TitleBitmapID and TitleBitmap values.
If you specified a ...
Then the bubble ToolTip...
gif, .jpg, or .jpeg image for UrlLoc
is automatically expanded to accommodate the image.
URL for UrlLoc
cannot be resized; if the URL:
is an HTML file, then the contents of the HTML file are displayed in the bubble ToolTip.
links to a website, then the default or specified web page at that website is displayed in the bubble ToolTip.
The Cookie, LinkStringID, LinkString, and Callback parameters are intended for use by add-in applications to display a hyperlink in the bubble ToolTip that, when clicked, calls a function to do something outside of the application; for example, open the add-in application's Help system.
